title: Opinion: Opinion | Observations From A Student of Political Communication - By Derek O'Brien
content: For a student of political communication, this week has been fodder. The language used to describe GST reforms has been nothing short of grand. "Landmark". "Biggest ever since the 1990s". The Opposition has been advocating for such 'reforms' for eigh

title: "Remember Why India Emerged As Key Partner": Ex-US Officials To Trump Amid Tariff Tension
content: Even as India-US relations witness a "moment of unprecedented discord" amid President Donald Trump's tariffs on Indian imports, former top American officials believe that ties can and must be restored.

title: GST Revamp: How Opposition-Ruled States Came On Board
content: The rationalisation of Goods and Services tax, done eight years after the flagship reforms were initiated, took place after a clear directive from Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered from the ramparts of the Red Fort on Independence Day.

title: Meghalaya Chief Minister Meets Amit Shah, Presses For Inner Line Permit
content: In a significant development, Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma on Thursday met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in New Delhi to discuss several key issues concerning the state's governance, identity and aspirations.

title: Trump Hosts Tech CEOs For Dinner At White House, Elon Musk Not Invited
content: Donald Trump hosted a high-powered group of tech executives at the White House on Thursday as he showcased research on artificial intelligence and boasted of investments that companies are making around the United States.

title: "How Dare You?" Ajit Pawar's Heated Exchange With Woman IPS Officer Over Excavation
content: Ajit Pawar was purportedly heard speaking to a woman IPS officer, Anjana Krishna, who was taking action against the illegal excavation of soil in Solapur.

title: Telangana To Resume Work On Collapsed Tunnel, Sets December 2027 Deadline
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy has set December 9, 2027, as the deadline for the completion of the long-pending Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) Tunnel Project.

title: Putin Slams Trump For Using 'Colonial Era' Tactics To Pressure India, China
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has reprimanded his US counterpart Donald Trump for attempting to exert colonial-era pressure tactics on leaders of "powerful economies" like India and China, saying that is not the way to deal with the "partners".

title: Siddaramaiah, Family Given 'Clean Chit' By Judicial Commission In MUDA Case
content: A judicial commission has given a 'clean chit' to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his family in connection with the alleged Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA) land allotment case.

title: Anil Ambani, RCom's Loan Accounts Declared 'Fraud' By Bank Of Baroda
content: In a significant step, Bank of Baroda, one of India's leading public sector banks, has declared the loan accounts of Reliance Communications Ltd. (RCom) and its erstwhile Director, Anil Ambani, as 'fraud', according to an exchange filing.

title: Trump Rebrands Department Of Defense As 'Department Of War'
content: President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order Friday to rebrand the Department of Defense as the Department of War, his latest effort to project an image of toughness for America's military.

title: Trump's Personal Rapport With PM Modi 'Gone Now', Lesson For All: Ex-US Official
content: President Donald Trump had a very good personal relationship with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, but "that's gone now", US' former National Security Adviser John Bolton has said.

title: Witness In Sheena Bora Case Backtracks After Charges Against Probe Agency CBI
content: Vidhie Mukerjea, a key prosecution witness in the Sheena Bora murder case, claimed in an affidavit submitted in a Mumbai court on Thursday that the CBI had recorded her statement after the arrest of her mother and key accused Indrani in 2015.

title: Trump Vows "Fairly Substantial" Tariffs On Semiconductors "Very Shortly"
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday the United States will soon put a "fairly substantial tariff" on semiconductors coming into the country, after previously threatening a 100-percent levy on the chips.

title: Mob Kills Woman, Injures Husband Over Suspicion Of Witchcraft In UP: Cops
content: A 52-year-old woman was killed and her husband seriously injured by villagers who attacked them with sharp-edged weapons on suspicion of witchcraft, police said on Thursday.

title: Trump Says Will Speak With Putin Soon
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday he would speak soon with Russia's Vladimir Putin, after his call earlier in the day with Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders.

title: Dharmasthala Case: Religious Heads Meet Amit Shah, Demand NIA Probe
content: Pontiffs of various Maths from Karnataka under the banner 'Sanatan Sant Niyoga' called on Union Home Minister Amit Shah in New Delhi and demanded an investigation into the Dharmasthala case by the National Investigation Agency (NIA).

title: Man Jailed For 20 Years For Raping Minor Girl On False Marriage Promise
content: A man was sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by a court here on Thursday for raping a minor girl on promise of marriage, police said.

title: Trump Signs Order Cutting Tariffs On Japan Autos To 15%
content: US President Donald Trump signed an order Thursday to lower tariffs on Japanese autos, as Washington moves to implement its trade pact negotiated with Tokyo.

title: US Considers Visa Ban For Iran, Brazil For UN Meeting In New York
content: The Trump administration already has denied visas for Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas and his large delegation to attend a high-level U.N. meeting this month and is now considering ramping up restrictions on several other delegations.

title: Airbus acknowledges timely project completion by Belagavi based company Aequs
content: Mike Broetzmann, Head of Procurement and Supply Chain Transformation, Airbus Aerostructures GmbH, acknowledged the effort of the team members for the success of the project

title: Bombay HC shifts Sanatan Sanstha defamation case to Kolhapur from Goa over ‘safety’ issue
content: The suits arose from comments linking Sanatan Sanstha and its members to the murders of a scribe and rationalists

title: Kamareddy floods: Homes, hopes and harvests swept away in deluge of a lifetime
content: The Ganesh Chaturthi festival brought not cheer but chaos as record rains turned Kamareddy into a disaster zone. Colonies were submerged, vehicles washed away, crops destroyed and hundreds forced to seek shelter on rooftops and relief camps. In three days, the district received 39.98 cm of rainfall — 40.7% of its annual average. P. Laxma Reddy reports from the worst-hit areas

title: High Court suspends life sentence of Satlok Ashram head Rampal in disciples' death case
content: In 2018, the head of Satlok Ashram and some followers were held guilty in two separate cases related to murder, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy registered against them

title: Too many students, too few teachers in Karnataka
content: A whopping 85,495 teaching posts are vacant across government-run educational institutions in Karnataka, with guest faculty making up for them. On Teachers’ Day, Jayanth R. looks at its debilitating impact on quality of education

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslip in Kullu leaves 1 dead, 6 buried
content: A total of 1,212 roads are closed in Himachal Pradesh, of which 289 were blocked in Mandi, 231 in Kullu, 211 in Shimla, 192 in Chamba district

title: Following adverse weather, four radars to be set up in J&K
content: Well-positioned radars are useful in improving the lead time in warning of sudden changes in weather that can bring intense rainfall

title: Govt. has put in place a robust mechanism for urea supply, says Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu
content: The State government has been able to get higher allocation of urea from the Centre due to the initiative taken by the Chief Minister, he says

title: GST reforms foster business-friendly environment, say trade bodies
content: Reduction in rates on essential goods helps consumers and businesses alike, besides easing the burden on households and improving affordability, they observe

title: Rampant development, not climate, pushing Himalaya to the edge
content: Disasters in August and September are exposing the steep cost of ignoring climate risks in the rush for development in the Hindu Kush Himalaya, experts say

title: TDP welcomes Centre’s decision to rationalise GST, reduce levies
content: These reforms will not only reduce household expenditure but also stimulate consumption, domestic market and attract investment, says the TDP State president

title: PM Modi to address military brass at conference in Kolkata next week
content: It will discuss creation of three integrated theatre commands, lessons from Operation Sindoor, and review progress in indigenous defence manufacturing

title: Revised Suspension of Operations pact tightens norms for Kuki-Zo groups
content: The revised pact, valid for a year, says stipend will be paid only through Aadhaar-linked bank accounts to those members who are present in the camps during inspection. Photo identity cards shall be provided by the Manipur Police, it says; agreement to be followed by a ‘tripartite dialogue for a negotiated political settlement under Constitution of India’

title: Reddy seeks support from Bihar, says INDIA bloc represents 63% population
content: Mr. Reddy said the “post of Vice-President is not limited to being the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha, but it is a symbol of democratic dignity and constitutional balance.”

title: If betrayed, Marathas will ensure Mahayuti bites the dust in polls, says Jarange-Patil
content: Movement will continue till every member of community eligible for benefits is included in OBC category, says activist; dissent surfaces as close aide dismisses govt. resolution as ‘complete sham’

title: Lokayukta police raid two police stations, arrest two personnel in Karnataka
content: In one case, police personnel allegedly demanded a bribe to file a chargesheet against a man booked for sexually assaulting a minor

title: Imposed tariffs against India for purchasing Russian energy products: Trump administration tells U.S. Supreme Court
content: In a 251-page appeal to the Supreme Court, submitted on Wednesday (September 3, 2025), the Trump administration said that “the President recently authorised IEEPA (International Emergency Economic Powers Act) tariffs against India for purchasing Russian energy products...”

title: People in Hyderabad hail GST relief on essentials, traders warn of implementation issues
content: I have been paying health insurance premiums for nearly a decade, and removing GST on it is a relief as it finally recognises that insurance is a necessity, not a luxury, says a teacher; though new structure applies from Sept. 22, updated MRP  tags will take 2-3 weeks to reach us, says a trader

title: T.N. government sanctions ₹2,126 crore for extension of metro rail from Poonamallee to Sunguvarchatram
content: The project has a corridor length of 27.9 km, with 14 stations, from Poonamallee to Sunguvarchatram. Of the total ₹2,126 crore allotted for the project, ₹1,836 crore has been assigned for land acquisition

title: Court orders police to execute non-bailable warrant on Minister Duraimurugan
content: A disproportionate case was filed in 2002 against Mr. Duraimurugan, his wife, brother Durai Singaram, son and Vellore MP D.M. Kathir Anand and daughter-in-law K. Sangeetha

title: Survey of Devadasis, sexual minorities on September 15
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah launches posters for both surveys, which will be held under the aegis of the Karnataka State Women’s Development Corporation

title: Two weeks on, Parliament yet to form Joint Committee on bills to remove PM, CMs
content: While the Congress is yet to take a decision on joining the panel, the Trinamool Congress, the Samajwadi Party, and the Shiv Sena (UBT) have declared their intent to keep away

title: After Supreme Court caution, Centre says talks on with States for special NIA courts
content: Supreme Court had earlier told govt that NIA undertrials cannot remain in jail indefinitely and have to be released on bail if exclusive courts are not set up for speedy trial

title: BJP calls the new GST regime ‘historic’; Congress asks how State’s revenue loss would be made up
content: The new GST regime would cause State an additional loss of ₹15,000 crore per year: Krishna Byre Gowda

title: NITI Aayog recommends multiple strategies to enhance pulses production
content: “The role of pulses in ensuring food security, nutritional well-being, and sustainable agriculture with significant environmental benefits is very critical,” says report

title: Transgender children, senior citizens need special shelter homes: NHRC
content: Garima Greh shelters currently provide residential support for transgender people between the ages of 18 and 60 only; funding delays, inexperienced staff, insufficient food hamper shelters, says NHRC

title: Mamata wants other parties to occupy Opposition benches in West Bengal, not the BJP
content: The BJP is the principal Opposition party in the Assembly; the Left parties and the Congress have no representation in the House

title: Auto, pharma sectors hail GST changes; airlines feel their wings clipped
content: Auto-makers expect the tax cut to boost demand; airlines slam higher GST on non-economy seats; small entrepreneurs worried about higher labour costs; textile industry disappointed over the 18% duty for garments priced above ₹2,500

title: Societies grappling to accept those who do not fit into the binary of man or woman, says NHRC chief
content: The country cannot grow unless transpersons, whose population is estimated at 4.88 lakh in India as per the 2011 Census, are left out of the mainstream, says Justice Ramasubramanian

title: Centre approves creation of new, independent class of ‘environment auditors’
content: Under the new rules, private agencies can get themselves accredited as auditors; much like chartered accountants, environment auditors can evaluate project compliance with environmental laws and adherence to best practices

title: MUDA case: Desai panel gives clean chit to Siddaramaiah’s family
content: The commission headed by retired judge P.N. Desai, which probed the case, said that the allotment of sites as compensation cannot be termed illegal

title: IISc retains second rank among top 100 HEIs in NIRF rankings
content: Despite having 32 State-run universities, only four universities managed to rank in the top 50 public universities in the list.

title: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Chouhan visits flood-affected Punjab
content: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema asked the Centre to demonstrate the same humanitarian spirit towards Punjab as it had in extending aid to Afghanistan

title: No shortage of urea, but only distribution issues, says Chief Minister
content: Farmers were impatient as they had to wait for long hours to take the fertilizer as a large number of them were turning up at the same time, the Chief Minister explained

title: GST cut on drugs, medical devices will provide relief to patients and their families, says healthcare industry
content: These reforms will improve the accessibility of medicines and ensure wider availability across healthcare settings, say industry players

title: ED custody of MLA Veerendra extended by four days
content: ED officials make a submission that they need more time to probe the betting sites and apps run by the accused who was allegedly operating an illegal betting operation worth several thousand crores of rupees

title: About 61.5% of 4,056 graves in Kashmir are of unidentified foreign militants, says study
content: The Save Youth Save Future Foundation’s study represents a commendable endeavour to clarify a complex and emotionally charged issue, says former CIC Wajahat Habibullah

title: AIADMK membership must have been renewed every five years on payment of ₹10 to enable a member to file a civil suit: HC
content: Justice P.B. Balaji also holds that a person who had contested elections as a candidate of another political party cannot claim to be a member of AIADMK too

title: Deaths of infants in M.P. hospital due to rat bites ‘outright murder’, says Rahul
content: Rahul Gandhi hit out at the State’s BJP government and Prime Minister Narendra Modi saying the health sector has been “deliberately handed over to private hands where treatment is now only for the rich”

title: Crime Branch FIR indicts Mamkootathil of grave crimes, including coercion to terminate pregnancy
content: FIR filed in the court of Judicial First Class Magistrate-III in Thiruvananthapuram, lists nearly 10 third-party complaints against MLA. The FIR does not mention any of the complainants as victims

title: Footage of custodial torture at police station ignites public outrage in Kerala
content: The alleged incident occurred in 2023. The victim, a part-time temple priest and Youth Congress worker, had released the incriminating footage, which he obtained through the Right to Information Act, after braving threats and inducements. Satheesan asks CM to dismiss the police personnel involved from service

title: GST reforms a ‘bundle of happiness’ for the masses: BJP
content: At a press conference in the national capital, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra says the cost of essential goods and services linked to food, clothing, and shelter would go down

title: Next-gen GST regime is a booster for MSMEs, say Karnataka trade bodies
content: Reforms enable MSMEs to focus on growth, innovation, and job creation, thereby contributing increasingly to Karnataka’s economic growth, they say

title: UAS-Bangalore ranked 11th in India, No. 1 in Karnataka among varsities in agri and allied sectors
content: UAS-Dharwad, which is ranked 35th nationally, is the only other university from agri and allied sectors from Karnataka to figure in the national list of ranking

title: Traffic restrictions in Hyderabad for Ganesh immersion on September 6
content: Citizens have been urged to avoid Necklace Road, NTR Marg, Tank Bund, Khairatabad and MJ Market during the procession.

title: A.P. Cabinet clears energy, other projects in State with ₹50,613 crore investment
content: Navayuga Engineering Ltd. at Paderu and Chinta Green Energy Ltd. in Kadapa are the major proposals involving over ₹30,000 crore investment

title: 'Disappointed' Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Sabalenka outlasts Pegula to return to Open final
content: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka has defeated Jessica Pegula 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the US Open semifinals.

title: 49ers add McCaffrey to injury report with calf issue
content: Running back Christian McCaffrey was added to the San Francisco 49ers' injury report Thursday night because of a calf issue.

title: Sources: North Carolina, Belichick ban Pats staff
content: North Carolina and first-year head coach Bill Belichick have banned the New England Patriots' staff from accessing the Tar Heels' program, sources told ESPN.

title: Messi says goodbye in Argentina, 'we'll see' on WC
content: Lionel Messi got emotional after playing his final competitive match in Argentina in a 3-0 World Cup qualifying win over Venezuela on Thursday in Buenos Aires, saying that finishing in front of his home fans was something he "always dreamed of."

title: Tyson, Mayweather Jr. to compete in exhibition
content: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. agreed to compete in an exhibition boxing match next spring, with details to be determined at a later date.

title: WR Cooper informs Raiders he's retiring from NFL
content: Wide receiver Amari Cooper has informed the Raiders that he intends to retire just days before the team will open the 2025 season at New England.

title: NCAA votes for single transfer portal window
content: The NCAA FBS Oversight Committee voted Thursday to move to a January transfer window and eliminate the spring transfer window.

title: 🏈 The Playbook: Week 1 fantasy football guide
content: Mike Clay's Playbook now includes the Shadow Report, providing an all-encompassing look at Week 1's matchups to exploit and avoid in fantasy.

title: Caitlin Clark’s season is over: What comes next for the Fever star?
content: The Fever continue their playoff chase without Caitlin Clark, who was ruled out for the rest of the season Thursday.

title: What will Saquon Barkley do for an Eagles encore?
content: 2,000 yards? Check. Super Bowl ring? Check. What's next? Some of the greatest RBs of all time have an idea.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early MLB free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: MLB Power Rankings: NL contender reenters top 10 as September begins
content: The AL's top teams are battling for the No. 1 seed while one NL contender is picking up steam at the right time.

title: The buzz ahead of NFL Week 1: Expectations for the Cowboys, playoff sleepers, fantasy predictions
content: Our reporters have intel on the Micah Parsons trade, teams and players flying under the radar and coaching situations to watch -- plus Week 1 fantasy nuggets.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: US Open rescue pup wins over Aryna Sabalenka -- and finds a home with Asia Muhammad
content: On Thursday, Muhammad, currently ranked No. 17 in doubles and the winner of 13 doubles titles on the WTA Tour, announced she had adopted Wilson.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

title: Solak predicts this season's NFL stat leaders: Every player who could finish No. 1 in five categories
content: Which QBs could top the NFL in passing yards or INTs? Who could dominate rushing and receiving? And what about sack leader candidates on defense?

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: College football best bets: Why to take the over for Cyclones-Hawkeyes
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 2, including a look at the Iowa State-Iowa game.

title: 'Hell, no. I can't be that fourth': What Carmelo Anthony did -- and didn't do -- to land in Springfield
content: Nineteen seasons, six teams, three gold medals and 28,289 points: Here's why Melo's career will forever be known for far more than just a Hall of Fame résumé.

title: Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: Idaho's 'Fightin' Taters' alternate helmets headline best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: The distinctive design will be paired with a sleek all-black uniform and pays homage to Idaho's deep connection to the potato industry.

title: Eagles, Cowboys traditional looks in season opener top NFL Week 1 threads
content: Here's a look at the Week 1 uniforms for all 32 NFL teams, led by the Saints debuting their gold uniforms.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: Roundabouts, sheepherding, hot sauce: USWNT stars in England
content: Adapting to a new life in a new country is tough, but these USWNT stars have had some fun this summer.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can the Fighting Nerds keep rolling at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night: Imavov vs. Borralho? Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks and betting insider Ian Parker gives his best bets.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs consider move for Man City's Nathan Aké
content: Tottenham are debating whether to reopen talks for Man City defender Nathan Ake. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Stone laid for ₹48.77 crore RoB & LHS at Chegunta
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
content: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan days after quake killed over 2,000
content: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann catches fever, skips tour of affected areas; toll 43
content: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, down with viral fever, missed accompanying Arvind Kejriwal on a tour of flood-affected areas. Kejriwal, after visiting Mann, assessed the flood situation in Sultanpur Lodhi. His visit coincides with controversy surrounding AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, accused of rape and other charges. Pathanmajra's arrest attempt sparked a political row, with allegations of revenge politics surfacing.

title: Battered North India logs its rainiest 2-week period in 14 years
content: North India experienced unprecedented rainfall between August 22 and September 4, with nearly three times the normal amount. This intense spell, the wettest in at least 14 years, triggered devastating floods in Punjab, record Yamuna levels in Delhi, and landslides in the Himalayas.

title: ‘Knife on son’s neck’: Delivery boy forces Noida woman to strip, records video
content: Gaurav, a 23-year-old hairdresser and grocery delivery person, was arrested for allegedly blackmailing a Greater Noida woman. He reportedly forced her to strip at knifepoint, threatening her children, and recorded explicit content. He then harassed her for months, sharing the images with her husband and online, leading to her reporting him to the police.

title: Population collapse: Pakistani warns Danish man; Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk has ignited debate by agreeing with a Pakistani man's claim about demographic shifts in Denmark, highlighting his ongoing concern about global population decline. Musk argues that declining birth rates pose a significant threat to civilization, potentially leading to economic stagnation and labor shortages. He has also warned about Japan's population decline, suggesting AI as a potential solution.

title: 'No solution on battlefield': India flags Ukraine conflict at UN
content: At the UNGA, India's envoy Parvathaneni Harish urged dialogue to resolve the Ukraine conflict, emphasizing the human cost and advocating for humanitarian aid. He welcomed diplomatic efforts like the Alaska Summit and highlighted PM Modi's engagement with global leaders. Harish also addressed the conflict's global economic impact, particularly rising fuel prices.

title: Happy teachers' day: Top 50 wishes, messages to share with your teachers
content: India celebrates Teachers' Day on September 5th, commemorating Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan's birth anniversary. This day honors teachers' profound impact, shaping students' minds, character, and futures. From academic guidance to life lessons, teachers inspire and empower. Heartfelt wishes, messages of gratitude, and inspirational quotes are shared to express appreciation for their dedication and influence, recognizing their role as mentors and guides.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,800; BSE Sensex crosses 81,000 mark
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday as the market continued to react positively to GST rate cute announcements. While Nifty50 was above 24,800, BSE Sensex was up almost 300 points.

title: Trump speaks on Elon Musk: Calls out plans; reignites political-tech crossover
content: Donald Trump has shared his views on Elon Musk, describing him as a "super genius" with some issues to resolve. This follows a fallout between the two after Musk criticized Trump's tax bill. Despite past tensions and Musk's talk of forming a new party, Trump hopes he will return to the Republican fold, with prominent MAGA figures echoing this sentiment.

title: Pickles or whisky? Pickle parcel scam to dry Bihar unmasked
content: Ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, liquor smuggling attempts are escalating. Railway Protection Force seized a 'pickle' shipment at Varanasi Junction, uncovering 283 whisky bottles destined for Patna. This follows previous incidents, including the discovery of 316 bottles on the Lucknow-Barauni Express and arrests in Gorakhpur, highlighting intensified efforts to smuggle alcohol into the dry state.

title: US Open 2025: Bhambri's dream run ends in semis
content: Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski of Britain triumphed over India's Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus in a thrilling US Open semifinal. After dropping the first set, the British pair rallied to win 6(2)-7, 7-6(5), 6-4. Bhambri and Venus, despite a strong tournament run including impressive victories, couldn't maintain their early lead.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests Adani Ports and Jayaswal Neco Industries as top stock picks for September 5, 2025. NIFTY is expected to consolidate between 24,400 and 25,000. A move above 25,000 could lead to 25,250.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is monitoring employee phone usage. Workers must now report the percentage of work-related use on company phones. Reimbursements will be adjusted accordingly. This is part of cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy. Employees are expressing concerns about micromanagement. Amazon defends the policy as a return to its performance-driven roots. Other companies are also tightening expense policies.

title: Maratha quota storm: Fadnavis dials Chhagan Bhujbal after cabinet no-show
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis reached out to Chhagan Bhujbal, addressing OBC concerns over a government resolution regarding Maratha reservations. Bhujbal, after skipping a cabinet meeting, expressed apprehension that the GR could lead to blanket reservations for Marathas via Kunbi certificates.

title: ‘Deliver Rs 500 crore or die': MP woman judge gets death threat
content: A judge in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district received a threatening letter demanding Rs 500 crore. The sender, claiming to be associated with a dacoit gang, threatened to kill Judicial Magistrate Mohini Bhadauria if the ransom wasn't paid by September 1.

title: Govt revamps GST: Rates reduced on nearly 400 goods — Here’s how cuts will reach consumers by Sept 22
content: Following the government's GST rate reductions on numerous goods and services, Indian companies are adjusting prices to benefit consumers by September 22. FMCG firms may increase product quantity for fixed-price items. White goods companies anticipate a demand surge, while hotels offer reduced rates for check-in payments. Car dealers, however, face potential losses due to existing inventory and revised cess structures.

title: Asia Cup: Yuvraj's advice to Gill, Abhishek: 'Don’t repeat my mistake'
content: Yuvraj Singh is encouraging young cricketers Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma to take up golf, drawing from his own experiences. He believes that incorporating golf into their routine can help them relax, reduce mental fatigue, and ultimately improve their performance on the cricket field.

title: Historic! Bavuma becomes first SA captain in 27 years to achieve this rare feat
content: South Africa clinched a historic ODI series victory against England at Lord's, their first in England since 1998. Matthew Breetzke's impressive 85 propelled the Proteas to 330, securing a 5-run win. England's struggles continue, marked by four consecutive ODI losses and a concerning post-World Cup performance. The final match on September 7 offers England a chance to salvage pride.

title: NFL Week 1 Spotlight: Travis Hunter's fearless dual-role debut
content: Travis Hunter, the Jaguars' highly anticipated rookie and Heisman Trophy winner, is set to debut as a two-way player against the Carolina Panthers. Drafted No. 2 overall, Hunter will contribute as both a wide receiver and cornerback, aiming to revitalize Jacksonville's offense and bolster their defense. His versatility is expected to significantly impact the team's performance.

title: 'You can’t talk to India, China like that': Putin hits back at Trump's tariff
content: Vladimir Putin has cautioned the United States against using tariffs and sanctions to pressure India and China, emphasizing that the colonial era is over and such tactics are inappropriate. He accused the Trump administration of attempting to weaken the leadership of these nations through economic pressure, noting their historical sensitivities and strong domestic political systems.

title: WH pushes 'warrior ethos': Trump revives 'dept of war'; Hegseth gets new title
content: Donald Trump has renamed the US department of defence to the department of war. The White House stated that Trump will sign an executive order. This permits the use of the new title as a secondary name. Pete Hegseth will be known as the secretary of war. Pentagon websites and signage will also be updated. Trump mentioned the history of victory associated with the department of war.

title: Happy Onam 2025: Top 50 Wishes, Messages, and Quotes for loved ones
content: Onam, a ten-day festival celebrated in Kerala, honors the legendary King Mahabali and his prosperous reign. Families and friends unite, adorning homes with pookalams and sharing heartfelt wishes. The festival, filled with joy and gratitude, emphasizes togetherness and the importance of cherishing traditions, love, and kindness.

title: Messi emotional before potentially final WC qualifier in Argentina - Watch
content: Lionel Messi marked a potentially final World Cup qualifier on home soil with a goal, leading Argentina to a 3-0 victory over Venezuela. The emotional match at Ms Monumental stadium saw tributes to Messi, with fans celebrating his illustrious career. Youngster Franco Mastantuono also impressed in his first international start, while Messi's two goals highlighted Argentina's dominance.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
content: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Gretzky and Canada’s identity: Why he no longer defines hockey
content: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: After paralysis, Reese Ketler hears a doctor’s unexpected message
content: In 2019, Reese Ketler's hockey career ended abruptly due to a spinal cord injury. Doctors initially feared he might never walk again. Through intensive rehab and unwavering determination, Ketler defied expectations and returned home early. Now, he inspires thousands as a content creator, proving life continues after tragedy and sharing a message of hope and resilience.

title: Shock comeback! Cricket legend, 41, ends retirement to play for Samoa
content: Ross Taylor, the former New Zealand cricket star, is set to make a comeback to the sport after a four-year retirement. He will be representing Samoa, his mother's native country, in the upcoming Twenty20 World Cup qualifying series. Taylor aims to contribute his extensive experience to the team and help Samoa secure a spot in the 2026 World Cup.

title: Kuki groups agree to renew suspension of ops; open key Manipur NH
content: Ahead of PM Modi's Manipur visit, significant peace deals have been finalized. The Kuki-Zo Council agreed to open National Highway 2, while Kuki militant groups renewed their suspension of operations, affirming Manipur's territorial integrity. This agreement hints at future political dialogue for a settlement under the Constitution. The Kuki groups will deposit arms and delist foreign nationals.

title: 'We’re having good dialogue': Trump says he'll speak with Putin; admits Ukraine war hard to resolve
content: US president Trump announced plans to speak with Vladimir Putin soon, following discussions with Volodymyr Zelensky and European leaders. This comes amidst ongoing Russian attacks on Ukraine and Putin's strengthened ties with China and India. Trump and Putin last met in August, focusing on the war in Ukraine, but failed to reach a ceasefire agreement.

title: 'Kissing bug': Rare and deadly Chagas disease spreading across US
content: Chagas disease, transmitted by kissing bugs, is quietly spreading across the US, now confirmed in over 30 states. Early detection is crucial as the parasitic infection can lead to severe heart and digestive issues, often remaining unnoticed for years. Public health officials urge preventative measures and increased awareness among physicians to combat this rising threat.

title: 'Not that high': Donald Trump vows 'fairly substantial' chip tariffs soon
content: President Trump declared the imminent imposition of a "fairly substantial tariff" on imported computer chips during a White House dinner with tech executives. This announcement follows previous threats, including a potential 100% tariff on semiconductors from companies not investing in the US. The move comes amid a US-China trade war and competition in high-end semiconductor development, while Trump seeks a Supreme Court ruling on broader tariff legality.

title: Centre to keep watch to ensure lower prices follow GST revamp
content: The government is closely monitoring price changes following GST reductions on nearly 400 items, expecting industries to pass on benefits to consumers starting September 22. Indirect tax authorities are collecting current prices for comparison, and NDA MPs are tasked with ensuring companies don't pocket the gains.

title: Russell Wilson’s surname legally adopted by Ciara’s son with rapper Future
content: Ciara has legally added her husband Russell Wilson's last name to her eldest son, Future Zahir's, name, reflecting Russell's significant role as a stepfather. This decision, years in the making, symbolizes the couple's commitment to their blended family. Russell's philosophy of loving all children equally resonates with their united and supportive family dynamic.

title: Supreme Court to probe green norms violation in Himalayan region
content: The Supreme Court is set to investigate the alleged environmental violations in Himalayan development projects, suspected of causing recent devastating floods and landslides. The court issued notices to multiple government bodies and states, expressing concern over illegal deforestation. The PIL seeks an SIT to determine the causes of these disasters and suggest protective measures for the Himalayan ecology.

title: Rural India's total fertility rate dips to replacement rate
content: India's Total Fertility Rate (TFR) has declined to 1.9 in 2023, below the replacement level of 2.1, while rural India's TFR reached the replacement rate for the first time. Bihar recorded the highest TFR at 2.8, and Delhi had the lowest at 1.2. The Gross Reproduction Rate (GRR) for India is estimated at 0.

title: 'Param Sundari' Box Office: Sidharth-Janhvi's rom-com wraps up first week under Rs 40 cr
content: ‘Param Sundari,’ starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, earned ₹39.85 crore in its first week. The film saw a dip in collections during weekdays after a strong opening weekend. Facing competition from new releases like ‘Baaghi 4’ and ‘The Bengal Files,’ its box office performance in the coming days will be crucial.

title: GST reforms 'Diwali Dhamaka', meant to better lives, says PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the GST reforms as a "Diwali Dhamaka," emphasizing their role in simplifying the tax system, improving citizens' lives, and boosting economic growth. He criticized the previous Congress regime for high taxes on essential goods, highlighting the current government's focus on savings for common people.

title: Rate cut will help neutralise adverse impact of US tariffs: Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal announced that GST reductions will stimulate domestic demand, offsetting US tariffs' impact. The government is collaborating with 50 nations on complementary products and exploring export opportunities in the UAE, Singapore, and Africa. An Export Promotion Mission is awaiting Union Cabinet approval, with ongoing efforts to decriminalize laws and boost domestic consumption.

title: India, Singapore plan strategic partnership
content: India and Singapore have unveiled a comprehensive strategic partnership roadmap to enhance collaboration across various sectors, including economic cooperation, skill development, and digitalization. The agreement, announced during PM Modi's talks with Singaporean PM Lawrence Wong, focuses on strengthening ties beyond traditional areas, with an emphasis on advanced manufacturing, green shipping, and civil nuclear energy.

title: Trump’s personal rapport with Modi is gone: Former US NSA
content: John Bolton claims the once-strong personal relationship between Donald Trump and Narendra Modi has deteriorated, signaling a potential shift in US-India relations. Bolton warns world leaders that personal ties with Trump won't guarantee protection from his unpredictable foreign policy decisions. This revelation comes amid growing tensions between the two nations, fueled by trade disputes and shifting geopolitical priorities.

title: Was Sonia voter before she was citizen? Court to hear plea for FIR
content: A Delhi court has scheduled a hearing for September 10 regarding a criminal complaint against Sonia Gandhi. The complaint alleges that her name appeared on electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen in 1983. The petition claims this violated the Representation of the People Act, as non-citizens are ineligible to register as voters.

title: Amid allies' JPC boycott, Congress drags feet on nominations
content: Despite government efforts to engage Congress in nominating members for the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on bills concerning the dismissal of jailed ministers and chief ministers, Congress has yet to respond. This delay reflects potential pressure on the party due to boycotts from key allies.

title: School must go on, so farmer in Rajasthan moves out of home with family
content: In a heartwarming act of selflessness, farmhand Mor Singh offered his home to 50 students in Rajasthan's Piplodi after their school collapsed, killing seven. Singh and his family now live in a makeshift shack, prioritizing the children's education.

title: Pawan Khera's wife gets ERO notice for registering as voter in 2 seats
content: Kota Neelima, wife of Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera, faces an Election Commission notice for dual voter registration in New Delhi and Telangana, a violation of the Representation of the People Act. This follows a similar notice issued to Khera, who has since applied to remove his name from Delhi's Jangpura electoral roll after BJP flagged the duplicate enrollments.

content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're a long way from discovering the list of 45 nations who will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the full field of 48 . Mauricio pochettino scored the very first goal in a 5-1 win over Macau .

content: "my wife absolutely kills it, and hopefully, award season coming around, people make the right decision," Allen says . he says he was just so proud of his wife, actress and singer hailee Steinfeld's performance . "it was a lot of different aspects of life," Allen said in an interview .

title: These games define the Mizzou-Kansas rivalry
content: the second home game of the season will go to a commercial break before the fourth quarter begins . it has become customary that the Mizzou fans in attendance will lob F-bombs in unison at their biggest rival . the rivalry resumed in 2021, with Kansas winning the first three games .
